  • Lens Spaces \(L(p,1) = \mathbb{S}^{3}/\mathbb{Z}_{p}\) As Circle Bundles Over \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\)
  • View page source

Lens Spaces \(L(p,1) = \mathbb{S}^{3}/\mathbb{Z}_{p}\) As Circle Bundles Over \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\)ÔÉÅ

This notebook demonstrates usage of circle_bundles on a dataset endowed with a (non-Euclidean) metric.

Given a vector \(v\in \mathbb{S}^{2}\) and an integer \(p\in \mathbb{Z}\), one has a continuous, free right \(\mathbb{S}^{1}\)-action on \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\) defined by \(q\cdot e^{i\theta} = qe^{i\frac{v}{2}}\) (here we are identifying \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\) with the unit quaternions and \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\) with the pure imaginary unit quaternions). The hopf projection map \(\pi:\mathbb{S}^{3}\to \mathbb{S}^{2}\) defined by \(\pi(q) = qvq^{-1}\) is equivariant with respect to this action, so we obtain a new principal \(\mathbb{S}^{1}\)-bundle whose total space is the lens space \(\mathbb{S}^{3}/\mathbb{Z}_{p}\) (and whose projection map is defined by \(\widetilde{\pi}([q]) = [\pi(q)]\)). The Euler number of this bundle is \(\pm p\).

import numpy as np
import circle_bundles as cb

First, generate a sample of the 3-sphere:

n_samples = 10000
s3_data = cb.sample_sphere(n = n_samples, dim = 3)

10000 samples from S3 generated.

Compute base projections to \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\) using the Hopf projection map

v = np.array([1.0, 0.0, 0.0]) 
base_points = cb.hopf_projection(s3_data, v = v)

Construct an open cover of \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\):

n_landmarks = 80
s2_cover = cb.make_s2_fibonacci_star_cover(base_points, n_vertices = n_landmarks)
s2_summ = s2_cover.summarize(plot = True)

Cover And Nerve Summary

  • $n_\text{sets} = 80$, $n_\text{samples} = 10000$

Recorded Simplex Counts:

  • $#(\text{0-simplices}) = 80$

  • $#(\text{1-simplices}) = 234$

  • $#(\text{2-simplices}) = 156$

  • No recorded simplices in dimensions $\ge 3$

\(\textbf{Main bundle computation}\): Compute local trivializations and characteristic classes using a quotient metric on \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\).

p = 4  #CHOOSE: a p-value for the quotient metric

total_metric = cb.S3QuotientMetric(p=p, v_axis = v, antipodal = False)    

lens_bundle = cb.build_bundle(
    s3_data,
    s2_cover,
    total_metric = total_metric,
    show=True,
)
\[\begin{split}\displaystyle \begin{aligned}\textbf{Diagnostics} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Trivialization error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\text{triv}} := \sup_{(j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\sup_{x\in\pi^{-1}(U_j\cap U_k)} d_{\mathbb{C}}(\Omega_{jk}f_k(x),f_j(x)) = 0.294\ \left(\varepsilon_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.094\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Mean triv error} &:\quad \bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}} = 0.063\ \left(\bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.020\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Surjectivity defect} &:\quad \delta := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\min_{v\in\{i,j,k\}} d_H\!\left(f_v(\pi^{-1}(U_i\cap U_j\cap U_k)),\mathbb{S}^1\right) = 0.433\\[3pt]\quad \text{Stability ratio} &:\quad \alpha := \varepsilon_{\text{triv}}/(1-\delta) = 0.519\\[3pt]\quad \text{Cocycle error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\mathrm{coc}} := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\left\|\Omega_{ij}\Omega_{jk}\Omega_{ki}-I\right\|_F = 0.310\\[3pt]\quad \text{Euler rounding dist.} &:\quad d_\infty(\delta_\omega\theta,\tilde{e}) = 0.035\\[14pt]\textbf{Characteristic Classes} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Stiefel--Whitney} &:\quad w_1 = 0\ (\text{orientable})\\[3pt]\quad \text{Euler number} &:\quad \pm 4\ (\text{spin})\end{aligned}\end{split}\]
